subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han compound|大|t1=person, big|火|t2=fire|ls=ic}} – the color of fire (a person by a fire).

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: Connected with {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*krak||blood; red}} in the STEDT database, whence {{cog|bo|ཁྲག||blood}}. Also compare {{och-l|赫|bright red}} and {{och-l|奭|majestic; red}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=chì
|c=cek3,cik3
|h=pfs=chhak
|md=chiáh/chék
|md_note=chiáh - vernacular (“red and bright” (of gold)); chék - literary
|mn=chhiah/xm,zz,tw:chhek/qz:chhiak
|mn_note=chhiah - vernacular; chhek/chhiak - literary
|mn-t=ciah4
|w=4tshaq
|mc=y
|oc=y
|cat=a,n
}}
